description: This file defines the ConfigFragment class, an Android Fragment responsible for displaying and managing user interface controls related to application configuration settings, loading and saving configuration data involving WebSocket and MQTT settings.

classes.name: ConfigFragment
classes.description: An Android Fragment responsible for displaying configuration options, pre-filling UI from stored configuration, validating user input, and saving configuration updates.

methods.name: onCreateView
methods.description: Inflates the fragment's layout from XML.

methods.name: onViewCreated
methods.description: Initializes UI elements, loads stored configuration into input fields, and sets click listeners for save/apply actions.

methods.name: readConfig
methods.description: Reads user input from UI, validates fields, and returns an AppConfig object if valid, otherwise shows error Snackbars.
